title: Learning Intern Project – UCLA STATS 20
text:
Active Quarters:
Winter 2023, Spring 2023, Winter 2024, Spring 2024, Summer 2024, Fall 2024

title: Learning Intern Project – UCLA STATS 20
text:
Instructors:
Dr. Michael Tsiang, Dr. Thomas Maierhofer, Dr. Ian McGovern, Dr. Edouardo Honig
As a Learning Intern (Undergraduate Teaching Assistant) for UCLA’s STATS 20, I supported over 320 students per quarter in mastering statistical programming in R, data manipulation, and fundamental data science concepts.

title: Learning Intern Project – UCLA STATS 20
text:
Key Contributions:

Led 12+ hours per week of group learning, office hours, and exam review sessions to strengthen student comprehension.

Assisted in grading midterm exams, evaluating free-response questions, and providing constructive feedback to enhance student understanding.

Designed and refined practice problems, midterm, and final review materials to align with course objectives and improve student preparedness.

Worked closely with faculty and PhD students to analyze common student errors, adjusting instructional methods to optimize learning outcomes.

Through this experience, I developed a strong foundation in teaching, mentorship, and instructional design, while deepening my expertise in R programming, statistical analysis, and data science education.

title: ALISSTAIR Integration - UCLA STATS 10 Labs
text:
ALISSTAIR Integration – UCLA STATS 10
As part of a STATS 199 Directed Research project under Dr. Thomas Maierhofer, I integrated ALISSTAIR, an experimental large language model (LLM), into the STATS 10 labs at UCLA. This project aimed to enhance student learning by leveraging AI to support statistical programming, coding comprehension, and data analysis skills.

title: ALISSTAIR Integration - UCLA STATS 10 Labs
text:
Key Contributions

Redesigned all five STATS 10 labs to incorporate AI-driven guidance, while preserving core statistical concepts.

Introduced real-world datasets (e.g., Spotify, Titanic) to enhance data literacy and engagement.

Developed prompt engineering sections to help students craft precise AI queries for coding and statistical analysis.

Tested and evaluated ALISSTAIR’s effectiveness, identifying potential misuse and advocating for its responsible integration to improve learning outcomes.

This project is set to be fully implemented in Winter 2026.
➡️ Try ALISSTAIR (Requires ChatGPT subscription)

title: Maxwell Chalekson
text:
I am an incoming M.S. Data Science student at Boston University, passionate about AI, machine learning, and data-driven problem-solving. 
    At UCLA, I worked on AI reliability and optimization in the Trustworthy AI Lab, analyzing large language models and improving computational efficiency.
  
  
    My work focuses on developing AI-driven tools for learning, decision-making, and user experiences, with interests in business, education, health, and emerging technologies. 
    I'm particularly fascinated by how AI can optimize human performance and enhance everyday life.
  
  
    Outside of work, I’m a marathon runner and bouldering enthusiast who enjoys tackling endurance challenges—both in fitness and complex machine learning problems.
    Always happy to connect and chat about AI, data science, or anything in between!
  
  Download My Resume


Education

Boston University (BU) | Boston, MA
M.S. in Data Science (Sept 2025 - May 2026)


University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA) | Los Angeles, CA
B.S. in Statistics and Data Science (Sept 2021 - June 2025)



Experience

UCLA
Trustworthy AI Lab (Sept 2024 - Feb 2025)
ALISSTAIR Project (May 2024 - Dec 2024)
Undergraduate Teaching Assistant (Dec 2022 - Dec 2024)


Manhattan West
Data Analyst Intern (June 2023 - Aug 2023)

title: Undergraduate TA – UCLA STATS 20
text:
Undergraduate TA – UCLA STATS 20

  
    As a Learning Intern (Undergraduate Teaching Assistant) for UCLA's STATS 20,
    I supported over 320 students per quarter in mastering statistical programming in R, 
    data manipulation, and fundamental data science concepts.
  

  
      Served as a TA in Winter 2023 – Spring 2024, Summer 2024, Fall 2024, under the instruction of 
      Dr. Michael Tsiang, Dr. Thomas Maierhofer, Dr. Ian McGovern, Edouardo Honig.
  

  Key Contributions

  
      
          Led 12+ hours per week 
          of group learning, office hours, and exam review sessions.
      

      
          Assisted in grading midterm exams 
          , evaluating free-response questions, and providing detailed feedback.
      

      
          Designed and refined practice problems, midterms, and final review materials 
          aligned with course objectives.
      

      
          Worked with faculty and PhD students 
          to analyze student challenges and adjust instructional methods for better learning outcomes.

title: ALISSTAIR Integration - UCLA STATS 10 Labs
text:
ALISSTAIR Integration – UCLA STATS 10

    
        As part of a STATS 199 Directed Research project under Dr. Thomas Maierhofer,
        I integrated ALISSTAIR, an experimental large language model (LLM), 
        into the STATS 10 labs at UCLA. This project aimed to enhance student learning 
        by leveraging AI to support statistical programming, coding comprehension, and data analysis skills.
    

    
        Project conducted during Summer 2024 – Fall 2024.
    

    Key Contributions

    
        
            Redesigned all five STATS 10 labs 
            to incorporate AI-driven guidance, while preserving core statistical concepts.
        

        
            Introduced real-world datasets 
            (e.g., Spotify, Titanic) to enhance data literacy and engagement.
        

        
            Developed prompt engineering sections 
            to help students craft precise AI queries for coding and statistical analysis.
        

        
            Tested and evaluated ALISSTAIR’s effectiveness 
            , identifying potential misuse and advocating for its responsible integration to improve learning outcomes.
        
    

    
        This project is set to be fully implemented in Winter 2026.
